question: In 1670s, two judicial systems were established under watch of Gerald Aungier at which of the following towns?
explanation: Gerald Aungier, the Second Governor of Bombay, took keen interest in establishing a judicial system there. During this period two judicial systems were established. The first Judicial system in Bombay was-established in 1670 which created the wing types of courts viz. Court of Custom Officer and Court of Deputy Governor- in-Council. This was done to facilitate the smooth running of the territory.
